messages.subject: Re: Trying school... (was It's been a while)
messages.msgSnippet: ... Good point, and did you ever notice how many shows( especially Disney channel) make it look sooooo fun. And if there is a slight problem it is solved in 30
messages.messageBody:
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, "Diana Tashjian"
<dtashjian@c...> wrote:
> I'm surprised that more
> homeschooled kids don't want to at least see what it's like since
> there's soooo much reference to school in our culture and society...
>
>
Good point, and did you ever notice how many shows( especially Disney
channel) make it look sooooo fun. And if there is a slight problem it
is solved in 30 minutes and happily ever after.

IMo

Michele

messages.subject: Trying school... (was It's been a while)
messages.msgSnippet: I know that there are all kinds of issues around this and I do sympathize with your situation and I m not sure how I d handle it if my kid wanted to go, but
messages.messageBody:
I know that there are all kinds of issues around this and I do
sympathize with your situation and I'm not sure how I'd handle it if
my kid wanted to go, but sometimes I'm surprised that more
homeschooled kids don't want to at least see what it's like since
there's soooo much reference to school in our culture and society...
My son Nick has never evinced any interest in going, I think because
he loves being master of his own time...

Diana Tashjian
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kate" <windystreet@...>

<snip>
> But I've run into a problem. My youngest child wants to go to
> school.
<snip>
